Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of Isis standing. Mould-made from a two-piece mould and hollow. Brown Nile silt. Complete.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Roemer and Pelizaeus Museum, Hildesheim. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Possibly from Naukratis, known only by old records. A number of examples known from the Louvre, included examples with an Antinoopolis provenance (Dunand 1990, nos. 396-402) and from Sunufar, now in Cairo (Dunand 1979, no. 32, Cairo 60590). This is not a standard for for Naukratis, but more akin to Fayum and Upper Egypt types. Dunand, F. 1979. Religion Populaire en Égypte Romaine, Leiden. Dunand, F. 1990. ‘Musée du Louvre. Département des antiquités égyptiennes. Catalogue des terres cuites grécoromaines d'Egypte’. Paris 349.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.181) (Phase 3)
